definitions.definition: A type of fruit in which the often edible flesh arises from the swollen base of the flower and not from the carpels .
examples: The best-known example of a pome is the apple.

definitions.definition: A ball of silver or other metal , filled with hot water and used by a Roman Catholic priest in cold weather to warm his hands during the service .
Alternative form of pomme ( “ green roundel in heraldry ” ) .

main_definition: ( botany ) A type of fruit in which the often edible flesh arises from the swollen base of the flower and not from the carpels .
secondary_definitions: ( Roman Catholicism ) A ball of silver or other metal , filled with hot water and used by a Roman Catholic priest in cold weather to warm his hands during the service .
Alternative form of pomme ( “ green roundel in heraldry ” ) .
